title: Push Settings

appName.description:
The name of the app that the push message should be sent to.
Credentials for the app must be registered in the Push Notifications Service.

description: Notification, customizable for Android and IOS separately

data.description: Flat map of additional strings of data.

PayloadFcm.description:
Push notification payload, allowing to tweak platform settings independently.
E.g. allows to send a silent push to Android, but a non-silent push to iOS if the user has an iOS device.

settings.description:
A map of additional Android and IOS push notification properties according to the official documentation.

iOS documentation: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/usernotifications/setting_up_a_remote_notification_server/generating_a_remote_notification
iOS supported properties:
  - badge
  - sound
  - category
  - content-available
  - mutable-content
  - thread-id
  - priority

Android documentation: https://firebase.google.com/docs/cloud-messaging/http-server-ref
Android supported properties:
  - collapse_key
  - priority
  - restricted_package_name
  - sound
  - channel_id
  - icon

PushNotification.description:
Notification title and body, handled by the OS and displayed in the notification center.
If this object is omitted, a silent push notification is sent.
